projectGridLines.title: Title: Technology Advancement and Testing of Bionic Hand (Multi-disciplinary)
projectGridLines.description:
Title: Technology Advancement and Testing of Bionic Hand (Multi-disciplinary)

Description: Building on several prototypes already developed, this project focuses on refining and

advancing the technological aspects of the bionic hand. Interns will work on improving control

algorithms, enhancing sensor integration, optimizing mechanical designs, and contributing to the

miniaturization and efficiency of the electronics. The goal is to push the boundaries of existing prototypes

to achieve a market-ready product.

Skill sets:

Mechanical Engineering –

? Mechanical design using CAD software (SolidWorks)

? Knowledge of mechanical structures and ergonomics for prosthetic devices

? Prototyping and testing of mechanical components

Robotics/Control Systems –

? Signal processing and control systems for myoelectric control

? Machine learning for adaptive control optimization

? Integration of sensors, encoders, and actuators for precise control

Electronics/Electrical Engineering –

? Microcontroller programming (e.g. Arduino, Raspberry Pi, STM32)

? Circuit design, PCB layout, and hardware troubleshooting

? Power management for embedded systems

Traits expectation:

? Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

? A passion for innovation in assistive technology

? Ability to work in a fast-paced R&D environment

? Strong collaboration and communication skills

Expected learning:

? In-depth experience in advanced prosthetic design and development

? Understanding of product development from prototype to pre-commercialization

? Exposure to cutting-edge technology in bionics

Specific courses required for project execution:

Mechanical Engineering –

? Mechanical design

? Product design and development

? Mechanics

? CAD/CAM/3D Printing

Robotics/Control Systems –

? Robotics and automation

? Control systems engineering

? Signal processing

Electronics/Electrical Engineering –

? Embedded systems and microcontroller design

? Circuit design and electronics
